alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 8:11PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Coffee County through 900 PM CDT... At 810 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Goshen to near Dozier to McKenzie. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lee, Pine Level, Java, Chestnut Grove, Victoria, Frisco, Eanon, Lowry Mill, Wilkinstown, Zoar, Camp Humming Hills, Newby, Wise Mill, Roeton, Clowers Crossroads, Arcus, Bluff Spring and Jack. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
